sentences.text: The following patch should add multiarch support.
i could add a slightly more complicated patch that doesn't require switching to  dh9, if that's preferable.

-Build-Depends: debhelper (>= 7.0.50), libgtk2.0-dev (>= 2.10.1), intltool, dh-autoreconf, hardening-includes +Build-Depends: debhelper (>= 8.1.3~), libgtk2.0-dev (>= 2.10.1), intltool, dh-autoreconf, hardening-includes
On mar., 2011-12-06 at 12:46 -0800, Vagrant Cascadian wrote:
> The following patch should add multiarch support.
> i could add a slightly more complicated patch that doesn't require switching to  > dh9, if that's preferable.
Actually I will use the dh9 way for hardening stuff anyway.
really intended to make an upload soon, so don't hold your breathe.
> On mar., 2011-12-06 at 12:46 -0800, Vagrant Cascadian wrote:
>> The following patch should add multiarch support.
>> i could add a slightly more complicated patch that doesn't require >> switching to
> Actually I will use the dh9 way for hardening stuff anyway.
> really intended to make an upload soon, so don't hold your breathe.
Here's a slightly modified patch for this issue, which adds a versioned runtime dependency on the version of libgtk2.0-0 that includes multiarch support.
Still no urgency in Debian, but I'm pushing this patch to Ubuntu as part of the obsoletion of ia32-libs there.
Steve Langasek                   Give me a lever long enough and a Free OS Debian Developer                   to set it on, and I can move the world.
We believe that the bug you reported is fixed in the latest version of gtk2-engines-murrine, which is due to be installed in the Debian FTP archive:
A summary of the changes between this version and the previous one is attached.
Thank you for reporting the bug, which will now be closed.
If you have further comments please address them to 651223@bugs.debian.org, and the maintainer will reopen the bug report if appropriate.
Yves-Alexis Perez <corsac@debian.org> (supplier of updated gtk2-engines-murrine package)
(This message was generated automatically at their request;
if you believe that there is a problem with it please contact the archive administrators by mailing ftpmaster@debian.org)
- use dpkg-dev and debhelper hardening support
- add a runtime dependency on a multiarch gtk2.             closes: #651223
- 3_glib-single-include added, include glib.h instead of individual header        files, fix FTBFS with glib >= 2.32.                       closes: #665547
It seems you forgot to add  "Multi-Arch: same" in the control file.
